meanings.def: the being or spirit that is worshipped and is believed to have created the universe
examples: Do you believe in God?
Good luck and God bless you.
Christians believe that Jesus is the Son of God.
I swear by Almighty God that the evidence I shall give… (= in a court of law)
He has given up drinking and found God.
He saw the accident as the will of God.
Muslims have only one God.
Nothing ever shook her faith in God.
the Jewish God

meanings.def: (in some religions) a being or spirit who is believed to have power over a particular part of nature or who is believed to represent a particular quality
examples: Greek gods
the sun/rain god
god of something Mars was the Roman god of war.
The people worshipped pagan gods.
The Romans had many gods.
those who follow false gods

meanings.def: a person who is loved or admired very much by other people
examples: To her fans she's a god.

meanings.def: something to which too much importance or attention is given
examples: Money is his god.

meanings.def: the seats that are high up at the back of a theatre
examples: We could only afford to sit in the gods.

meanings.def: an event caused by natural forces beyond human control, such as a storm, a flood or an earthquake
used to emphasize a feeling of surprise or that you are determined to do something
used when you are expressing anger and the fact that you are impatient
examples: For the love of God, tell me what he said!

meanings.def: used to emphasize what you are saying when you are surprised, shocked or annoyed
examples: God, what a stupid thing to do!

meanings.def: used when you are leaving somebody, to say that you hope they will be safe, etc.
examples: Goodnight, God bless.

meanings.def: used to say that you hope that something will not happen
examples: ‘Maybe you'll end up as a lawyer, like me.’ ‘God forbid!’

meanings.def: used to say that you are afraid somebody will be in danger or that something bad will happen to them
examples: God help us if this doesn't work.

meanings.def: used to emphasize that you do not know something
examples: God knows what else they might find.
‘Where are they?’ ‘Goodness knows.’

meanings.def: used to emphasize the truth of what you are saying
examples: She ought to pass the exam—goodness knows she's been working hard enough.

meanings.def: used to show respect when you are talking about somebody who is dead
a person who thinks that they are particularly good at something or who thinks that somebody will find them particularly attractive
examples: He seems to think he's God's gift to women.

meanings.def: used to say that you hope that things will happen as you have planned and that there will be no problems
examples: I'll be back next week, God willing.

meanings.def: used to say that you are frightened of the idea of something happening
examples: Heaven forfend that students are encouraged to think!

meanings.def: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true
examples: Honest to God, Mary, I'm not joking.

meanings.def: used especially in questions to show that you are angry, surprised or shocked
examples: What in God's name was that noise?
Where in the name of Heaven have you been?

meanings.def: if the result of something is in the lap of the gods, you do not know what will happen because it depends on luck or things you cannot control
a religious man, especially a priest or a clergyman
to behave as if you control events or other people’s lives
examples: It is unfair to ask doctors to play God and end someone's life.

meanings.def: used to say that you very much hope or wish that something will happen or not happen
examples: Please God, don't let him be dead.

meanings.def: to make somebody very frightened, especially in order to make them do something
used to swear that what you are saying is true, especially in a court of law
used to say that you are pleased about something
examples: Thank God you're safe!
‘Thank goodness for that!’ she said with a sigh of relief.
Thank heavens I've found my keys.

meanings.def: used to say that you could easily have been in the same difficult or unpleasant situation that somebody else is in
used after a verb to emphasize a particular hope, wish, etc.
examples: I wish to God you'd learn to pay attention!

meanings.def: used to show surprise, lack of belief, etc.
